Articles.Content:
Like the title says, I get attachment nodes floating in the VAB when I grab new parts for whatever I'm building. They don't really cause me to much of an issue but if they can be fixed I would like to. I am running KSP as 32Bit with a good computer so memory is not an issue... I think.

Here is a picture of what I'm talking about.

![BcClkep.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/BcClkep.jpg)

Mod List

AsteroidDay

BahaSP

Chatterer

CommunityResourcePack

CrossFeedEnabler

FerramAerospaceResearch

HeatControl

InterstellarFuelSwitch

JSI

KerbalEngineer

KerbalJointReinforcement

KWRocketry

ModularFlightIntegrator

ModuleAnimateEmissive

MunarIndustries

NavyFish

NearFutureConstruction

NearFutureElectrical

NearFutureProps

NearFuturePropulsion

NearFutureSolar

NearFutureSpacecraft

ProceduralFairings

RealChute

RSCapsuledyne

SmokeScreen

Squad

StationPartsExpansion

ModuleManager.2.6.6

Output Log

[https://www.dropbox.com/home?preview=output_log.txt](https://www.dropbox.com/home?preview=output_log.txt)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-21T17:04:06Z" title="07/21/2015 05:04  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 21, 2015</time> by Marq**
  
Added Mod List and Output Log

We will need a mod list and an output\_log.txt minimum to be able to diagnose your issue (unless you are very lucky and someone sees this who has seen the issue before). See the "How to get support" sticky thread for details of how to provide these and for other troubleshooting steps you may be able to try yourself.

> 
> ProceduralFairings

I use PF as well and I get the same thing when I use the fairing bases.

It may be something to do with Procedural Fairings though there doesn't appear to be any direct evidence of this in the log.

However, there are quite a few exceptions from other mods in your log. I suggest you check Distant Object Enhancement, Connected Living Spaces, TAC Life Support and MechJeb to see if you have the correct versions for the version of KSP that you are running. What version is it, by the way? It looks quite old and you have some rather old mod versions installed too...
PF is what does it for me
